==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|木|曜}}

===Etymology===
/mokueu/ > /mokuyoː/. Originally it meant the planet Jupiter<ref name="Amoghavajra" />. A [[calque]] of {{cog|la|dies Iovis}} and its descendants, reinterpreting the day as having been named after the planet [[Jupiter]] (instead of the Roman god). Compare {{m|ja|木星|tr=mokusei|gloss=Jupiter (planet)}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{IPA|/mokujoː/|lang=ja}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|もくよう|hhira=もくえう}}

# {{lb|ja|archaic}} planet [[Jupiter]]
# [[Thursday]]

====Synonyms====
* {{l|ja|木曜日}} (mokuyōbi)

===See also===
* {{l|ja|七曜}} (shichiyō)
